Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Loz694
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. It was a lovely, nicely presented boutique hotel with uniquely styled rooms for extremey reasonable prices and situated on the edge of China Town making it accessible to walk to most places. However the best part of this hotel was the staff. They were extremely nice, helpful and did everything to make your trip the best possible experience. We arrived extremely early (6am) and were not meant to be able to check in till 2pm, however because the room was free they let us check in early at no extra cost. The Mini bar in the room was free with the exception of alcohol and a few snacks (this is what I mean about little things that just add that extra touch) On our last day our flight wasn't til 11pm at night but we woud have to check out at 12pm. This wasn't going to be a problem as we were going to sight see all day and collect our bags on the way to the airport. Unfortunately I was extremely ill through the night and the next day. We had checked out because we were meant to but I did not feel well enough to leave the hotel. Sitting in reception with 11 hours to kill and not feeling great the staff were concerned that they came over to offer a room for me free of charge so that I could feel more comfortable and rest - when it was time to leave for the airport we tried to pay and they would not allow it as I had been ill. They went above and beyond to make our trip great and it was truely a lovely experience to stay there - we definately wouldn't stay anywhere else if and when we return to singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and fun”
Reviews.Author: Annika L
Reviews.Content: The staff here were amazing (although I only met 2 reception girls) The rooms are very quirky although on the small side. The bath is outside too. Toilet and shower within the room with glass frosted panes of glass. But you had to leave that area to collect your towel which isn't ideal Close to the airport - about 20 minutes and costs about £10 Situated right in the heart of China Town So overall I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Quirky designer hotel that gets it right”
Reviews.Author: jamesy168
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary. Each room is individually themed, so no 2 are alike. Ours overlooked the pool and had many nice touches like a nespresso maker, iPod / iPhone charger - music dock & a very comfortable bed. I also liked that the designer furniture were real, not copies.

Reviews.Title: “Still My Favourite”
Reviews.Author: koroua
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and enjoy coming back each time. I have now also found my favourite room layout (209 - The Singapore room) although the room with the best title is 306 (TripAdvisor rules will not allow me to put in the title ...rofl). I have stayed in a different room everytime I have stayed and never disliked any but 209 with it's tiny terrace and glassed in wardrobe is fantastic. The hotel staff are great, the rooms are always clean and as a single female when travelling I always feel safe walking around the hotel at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Chic & Trendy”
Reviews.Author: Eurasian68
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night at this hotel. We booked the Aqua room, but were given an upgrade to Lifestyle room called "Untitled", which was spacious and clean. Almost everything was in white and decent beige tone - very cosy; along with the tub behind the bed. The bed itself was very comfortable to sleep in. Since it was only one night, we didn't mind the room having no closet to hang out our clothes. The only thing we found odd was the adjoining doors to the rooms to our left and right! All non-alcoholic beverages in mini bar was for free. Unfortunately, the Nespresso maschine in our room did not work. Breakfast was good. Staffs were very friendly and helpful. I would have given 5 stars rating if they reminded us of the facilities provided in the hotel eg. pool. The only negative point is that I found the room rates VERY expensive, despite the interior design. I just LOVE the location in Chinatown!

Reviews.Title: “We wanted to love this one”
Reviews.Author: Rene J
Reviews.Content: This hotel has so much going for it. We stayed for 3 nights in room 308 and enjoyed living in a wooden box. The service was impeccable throughout our stay. On arrival we were taken to our room and the facilities were explained in detail. Everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful which made us feel very welcome. Non alcoholic drinks in the mini bar are complimentary which is a nice touch. The Nespresso, Bose sound system and bathroom products added a touch of luxury. Other reviewers have commented about the lack of breakfast choices however we were able to order everything we wanted. Omelettes or eggs made in any style were quickly made and the restaurant staff were very attentive. Our bed was comfortable and the room well appointed. My wife did struggle getting in and out of the shower though which even if you have long legs is a bit of a challenge. The only negative we encountered is outside the hotel's control however is a downside to it's location. Sound insulation is minimum both from outside and inside the hotel. On Friday and Saturday night we were kept awake until after midnight due to the noise coming from the bars around the hotel. On Sunday night we slept lightly due to noise from within the hotel - chairs moving in the room next door / above, toilets flushing etc. As one of the main criteria of a hotel room is sleep quality we did not experience that. If noise was not an issue we would easily rate the hotel a 5. However after 3 nights broken sleep we can only rate the hotel a 3. If you are not a light sleeper we definitely recommend the hotel. If you are then you may wish to consider your options. We loved our stay other than the lack of sleep. Unfortunately because of that we will probably look for another hotel on our return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “The Almost Perfect Hotel You Want to Skip”
Reviews.Author: Carl W
Reviews.Content: Here is one of those infurating situations where a hotel has everything (almost) going for it and stops a yard short of being sensational. During my visit (February 9 - 17, 2012) I found that the hotel was beautifully appointed, had marvelous staff, a great restaurant, and a super location --not to mention the price. The only thing wrong was the room! My room was the size of two large beach towels. The bathroom was enclosed in a glass sleeve in one corner of this tiny room and the shower (which by the way was one of the most modern I've encountered) was in a second glass sleeve in another corner. There was no closet, no drawers, and my clothing had to hang over the area in which I had to work with my computer. They claimed not to have larger rooms when questioned but I know that was not true. If you travel to Singapore for a holiday, this hotel might be okay but if it's for business and you must work in your room, I'd suggest you try another hotel. No matter what, avoid room 302!

Reviews.Title: “A quirky boutique hotel, with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: callumx
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay at the New Majestic. I can imagine that it's quirky decoration might not be to everybody's tastes, but the design of each room is fun and interesting. The rooms had every facility that you would expect in a top hotel, including good quality double glazing (and complimentary ear plugs for those guests who are extra sensitive). The main reason we enjoyed our stay was the staff. They could not have been more friendly and helpful if they tried. Every question we asked was patiently listened to, and answered. Advice re restaurants and directions was gladly given. We were also provided with a room to freshen up in at the end of the afternoon once we had checked out (and we didn't have to ask for this). The pool and gym are both on the small side, so if physical exercise is your thing, then this might not be the hotel for you. We ate at the restaurant, and again the food and service were faultless. I felt that the location was superb. It was right on the edge of China Town, and on a relatively quiet street. There is a station for super efficient metro line direct to the centre less than 5 minutes walk way from the hotel, and it is only a couple of stops to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “A unique treat”
Reviews.Author: Heloni
Reviews.Content: If you want a big generic hotel room don't stay here. New majestic is much more interesting than that. We just stayed one night on a stop over in a premier garden room. We had excellent service with reception giving us an early check in free of charge and also giving a room to freshen up in before our evening flight which really make a different if you've been exploring the hot city all day. Free Wifi was good. The room was not large but had an outside patio area with bath. There was a little noise during the day from construction and occasionally from people walking past in the corridor but generally it was an really interesting place to stay and the outdoor bath was a luxurious touch.

Reviews.Title: “New Majestic - no problems”
Reviews.Author: KenaiAlaska
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property conveniently located in Chinatown near the Outram Road MRT station. Before we arrived, we had some misgivings due to some critical reviews on tripadvisor. However, we thought that criticisms of breakfast were totally misplaced (were the critics expecting Claridge's or the Waldorf Astoria?), and we couldn't understand the complaints about hot water--as long as you leave it turned on, there seemed to be plenty of hot water. And, noise was not an issue, perhaps because we were there over the Chinese New Year weekend. In short, we would strongly recommend this hotel to others and would almost certainly stay at the New Majestic if we go to Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Malingshu
Reviews.Content: I travel to Singapore for work several times a year and I am familiar with most of the hotels catering to both the business and leisure markets. With a one night stopover planned en route to Europe I wanted to try something different and was looking forward to staying at the New Majestic. The service was great, with the desk staff working very hard to make our stay enjoyable. For example, they kindly arranged an early morning check-out with breakfast takeaway. Unfortunately, our stay was marred by a number of factors: 1) I deliberatley booked the Premier Garden room but we were given an Aqua room instead because apparently the garden rooms were all booked out. While this was described as an "upgrade", it simply wasn't what I wanted. Given that the hotel sells itself on the unique character of each room, I would assume customer room choice would be of utmost importance when confirming bookings. 2) Nearby construction hammered away all day long at the back of the hotel - I know this isn't something that the hotel can manage, but be sure to check to see if it's been completed before you book. 3) The nearby pub was EXTREMELY noisy until the early hours of the morning. The Aqua room fronts the street so we heard every lover's tiff and drunken argument, and the street lights blazed into our room despite the shades. The hotel provides earplugs but it made little difference and only added insult to injury as I contemplated the loss of the quiet garden room at the back of the complex.

Reviews.Title: “A great boutique hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: darlingnikki71
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights with our two year old and it was great. We booked the garden room with an outdoor bath which was a nice touch. Free water and soft drinks were a nice touch too.

Reviews.Title: “A trendy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: omarrahim
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and was drawn to the fact that this hotel was in the Top 10 Trendiest Hotels in Asia. The hotel is in Chinatown away from the all skyscrapers but close enough to get to all all the action. Plus points Check in and out was very efficient Very friendly staff who will assist to plan an itinerary for your trip Bedding, towels and toiletries are all first class and would compete with any luxury hotel Every room is designed by a local artist uniquely. A stones throw away from the super efficient Singapore metro Complimentary water and soft drinks and juice was a bonus Negative points Breakfast was a huge let down both in terms of quality and choice. A number of other reviews have mentioned this so New Majestic Hotel please take note. It is slightly pricey for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Wierd and wonderful rooms”
Reviews.Author: LondonBullit
Reviews.Content: An unusual Hotel. Each room is styled differently. The walls and floor on my room were covered in plywood to give the effect of living in a box. I loved the high ceilings and exposed concrete beams. I also loved the retro furniture. The hotel was clean and the staff very friendly. I didn't try the pool. its looks like a kids play pool really. I didn't see anyone else use it either. The gym was OK and the hotel had free wifi. Breakfast was of good quality. Rice porridge was on offer which ended up being like just rice pudding.

Reviews.Title: “Design goes first before practicality”
Reviews.Author: dabawing
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd hotel I tried for my recent trip in Singapore. Location is much better than Wangz Hotel because it's less than 5 min walk from Outram Park MRT station. First impression was good, as our room was ready even it was at 10:XX which was quite early in the morning. Due to certain connection, I was glad to be upgraded to "the most expensive room in the hotel" as the front desk claimed. She then showed up to the room and introduced a bit. The suite on L4 was quite impressive in terms of design, with lots of "Double Happiness" words in Chinese all over the room. It seems like it was for a couple I believed? There were two bathtubs in the open bathroom (though with a bit funny face on the wall). Bed was lifted up so we had to climb up the ladder for the bed which was quite a new experience for us. After spending a day out, we returned to the hotel in the evening. We asked for newspaper at the front desk, who informed me that it was already placed in the room. However, when we got to the room, there was none. I called and asked if they had a spare copy. Unfortunately, they told me there was only one copy left in the lobby and asked me to go down and read it. Consider it was already 21:XX at night, I did not see anyone (or one or two like me) would ask for the newspaper. I wondered why they did not send me the last copy instead of leaving the newspaper idle for the rest of the night. It's the matter of flexibility of service. If they did send me a copy and there was another guest asking for it, would they try to look for one somewhere else? So I was a bit upset about "NO" in the first place. Later when my partner wanted to have a shower, she found out there was no hot water. Just before I was going to ask, I found the switch for hot water. What? I have never stayed in a hotel which I have to turn on the heater before shower. It made me feel like staying in a hostel, given that I was paying for around SGD300++ for a room. With the heater on, we would like to try the double bathtubs, however, no hot water was available after 15 min. At the end, we gave up this idea. After shower, we would like to watch DVD since I saw there was DVD player in room. Unfortunately they did not have any for rental when I called, so I needed to use my mobile to watch the TV drama for the night. The next morning, we tried the infamous Majestic restaurant for breakfast. Maybe it was complimentary, the selection was a bit small. Later, we went to try the pool, though not big, we were quite pleased to swim there. Overall, it was quite good to try this hotel since it's something special compared with other traditional hotels. If they can solve the problem of water heater, this hotel would be on my recommended list.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky fun rooms”
Reviews.Author: WildBush
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very small but quirky and innovative and the style of the property made for a more enjoyable way to stay in Singapore than in a typical corporate hotel. Very comfortable beds though lack of a proper bedside table. Wifi in the room was good. Decent size bathroom and great shower. Breakfasts were very average and a real let down. Hotel is located next door to Restaurant Andre - has to be the best restaurant in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Price and Major Inconveniences”
Reviews.Author: ATLTravelsALot
Reviews.Content: First of all, I read all the reviews on here carefully and can assure readers that all of them are accurate - both the positives and negatives mentioned. For me personally, the negatives far outweight the positives and I would never stay here again. First of all - a major problem not only with the noise but the area in general is the huge construction project going on directly beside the hotel and renovations within the hotel. Even if you want to stay here (which I cannot recommend given other Singapore/Chinatown options), don't even think about it until all the construction is complete. No assurance by hotel management about trying to minimize convenience can make up for the substantial loud noise that starts very early and goes on until past dark. Here is a clue from the room - a card on the desk states "We apologise for the noise outside. It is beyond our control. It is however, our duty to make it better for you. Here's something from us. Hope this helps." You guessed it - a pack of foam ear plugs!!! OK, besides the noise - the other negative comments I read on here are extremely accurate as well - inadequate hot water. One person can barely finish a shower without running out of hot water and if you are in one of the garden rooms with the tub outside, forget about being able to use it because there is not enough hot water to fill it. There is a switch on the room water to turn on/off the hot water heater. So, evidently there is one small hot water heater per room. This was very annoying to have to rush through showers for SGD 310 per night. Another annoyance - the internet speed is practically dial-up speed. Sure, it is free but it is practically useless. If you have to connect to TS/VPN type connections or use Skype/Exchange, forget about it. I ran speed test that were below 0.5mbps download. I called to complain and obviously management is used to these complaints from their reaction they said its the best the hotel has to offer. Also, the A/C cannot be controlled adequately. The vents were blowing cold air down onto the bed and the room was freezing. The in-room thermostats do nothing but raise/lower the fan speed (front desk verified this) so there is no need to try to control the temperature. The front desk told me to call down each time I wanted the A/C in the room on or off! Yes, no in between - either on or off. So, during my stay I would let the room cool down then call down and they would switch it off remotely (instantly). Then when the room got hot I would have to call again for them to turn it back on. So annoying. Restaurant/breakfast reviews on here speak for themselves. Not worth wasting your time writing about this. Marginally o.k., but in some ways just bad. Room was tiny - not any place to even put a suitcase. Overpriced basically. Staff generally were very pleasant and tried to be helpful - but I could tell they know what the problems are - they simply smile and do their best to cover up the flaws. I think most irritating on here is reading all the management responses, and how they tend to pick up on the positive things, especially on the negative reviews, and say "we look forward to your return". Why they can't see that these negative review actually matter and mean that people who have negative impressions will not be returning is beyond me. It is like management has their head stuck in the sand here and don't want to acknowledge the major issues. Hope this review is helpful. I managed to stick out the stay just because I didn't want to pack up and move to another hotel, but this place is not worth the price and has some major issues that anyone taking the time to consult Tripadvisor for advice will need to heed.

Reviews.Title: “Cool room”
Reviews.Author: denisenah
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of the hotels under the Unlisted Collection group. So far, my partner and I have planned a staycation at Wanderlust and loved it. We booked a one night stay at New Majestic in Nov. We came to the hotel knowing it was undergoing renovation. Who knew, that got us a free upgrade from the Premier Garden to the Lifestyle Room! We got the Fluid room which was really spacious and really well designed. Again, loved loved loved the Ploh bedding and bathrobes!! The swimming pool was also big and private enough for a leisurely swim. Beakfast the next day was great. It wasn't the best quality but I appreciated the effort to provide a good mix of Asian and Western cuisine. You also also get eggs and sausages/bacon included in the whole package. Conclusion: Great design of the hotel aside, it's perfect for tourists looking an offbeat experience of Singapore. New Majestic is located between Chinatown and the up and coming, "indie" Tanjong Pagar. You'll get the best of both worlds being here. I also recommend it to locals to go for staycations to escape from our country's urban hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “It's a great hotel but our room was too tiny”
Reviews.Author: 1elke
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is really great, we loved the lobby, the pool area, the amenities (kiehls products, free soft drinks & water) and the great eye for design. But we were a bit disappointed by our room. I had booked the junior lifestyle suite and thought it had a private outdoor garden area (as specified on the website), but apparently it was another that has this area. We don't mind small rooms as long as you can go outside, but that wasn't the case. So we felt a little bit claustrofobic. The breakfast was ok, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Not as as good as I hoped for”
Reviews.Author: Kittkey
Reviews.Content: To start with the good points, I liked the hotels location a lot - it was close to great food and hawker centres in China Town. The MRT was also close by. I found the staff to be very pleasant and helpful. I was worried about noise after reading some reviews but our room overlooking the street at the front of the hotel was fine and we slept well. There was a good selection of Kiehls toiletries and if I remember right the mini bar was free except beer, there was also a decent Nespresso coffee machine in the room. We booked a premier garden room which appealed due to pics I had seen of the outdoor space and the light, neutral room decor. When we arrived we were upgraded to a premier lifestyle king room which was pretty spacious. These rooms are all individually designed but I didn't really like the style of ours. It was all dark wood and bright red Chinese style, but just was a bit too bold and I found it off-putting rather than relaxing. The bathroom was also not very well designed. The shower was over the bath and to get into the bath or use the shower you had to step up about half a meter to the bath platform and then climb down into it. Myself and my partner both commented that it would not be suitable for some older or less abled visitors at all, and even I felt a bit precarious climbing in and out when the area was all wet. The breakfast wasn't very good. After trying once we skipped it every day though it was included and headed to the hawker centre instead. The rooms are also showing some wear and tear. The pool is fine for a dip to cool off but nothing more as it's very small and from here we could hear construction noise. They should also put some towels or robes by the pool as you don't get many in your room so if you use the pool have no dry ones left. All in all for the price paid I think there were too many faults and I don't think this place was value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish inconvenience hotel”
Reviews.Author: matmueller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this small overpriced hotel which supposed to be the hippest one in town. The lobby is cool designed but somehow guest are only there for taking pictures. There is no meeting point, no bar. We were even upgraded in a superior room but this one was so small and absolutely did not fit to travelers needs. We had an outside bath tup included in the room. Looked great but its actually useless. At the pool where only some chairs, there is no drinks or food supply there. We asked for an iron and staff delivered us a defected one. We mentioned that it is defect but staff did say that we were wrong it supposed to work. I would definitively not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Style Over Substance”
Reviews.Author: Rockruby
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the New Majestic Hotel and overall we had a reasonably enjoyable stay. It is easy to see why it was listed in the "Trendiest" section in Travellers Choice, but it is also easy to see why it is not higher than no. 30 in Trip Advisor's Singapore Hotels. The good points are great location (2 minutes walk from Outram Park MRT), proxomity to great restaurants and bars (Oso, Andre and Absynthe are all neighbours), stylish rooms and a great looking hotel and surrounding areas. Nespresso machine was good. The pool was good (although the chairs which looked great were uncomfortable which combined with the construction noise noted later made the pool area not a relaxing place to chill out). Negatives are: Breakfasts were just okay (had to ask for water, eggs underdone as they were at Naumi, is this a Sigapore thing?), one staff member in the restaurant particularly sour faced. It is hard to understand why breakfasts weren't better: the New Majestic Restaurant is an award winning restaurant and we had a delicious lunch there. The rooms, while amazingly stylish, lacked basic features which make a room comfortable. Bed was hard and too short (I'm not even 6 foot and my feet hung off the end). There were no bed side tables (one side had a nook in the wall) and only one side had access to lighting apart from the bedside). There was only a tiny space for hanging clothes up and nowhere to put suitcases other than under the bed. The bathroom also offered nowhere to put any toiletries and nowhere to hang a towel. The hot water also seemed to run out quickly. While the hotel can't be blamed for construciton noise in the area (construction is everywhere in Singapore) it did detract from the hotel experience (pool area, outside bath were both made far less relaxing) as the construction is right next door, at times very loud and goes on until quite late at night. Also, at check in we were put into a Premier Pool Room despite having booked a Premier Garden Room. The staff quickly moved us into the right room, but i have to recommend against booking the Premier Pool room for any more than one night, it really was tiny. I think the New Majestic would be fine for a short stay of one or two nights. Location is great and it really is a stylish hotel. If you are planning a longer stay where you spend time relaxing around the hotel you would be better off looking elsewhere, at least while the construction work is still going.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, a real find in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Numptyheid
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at the New Majestic for four nights, whilst stopping over en route to Sydney. I chose the hotel based on previous reviews and the price, especially when compared with other hotels in Singapore. It turned out to be a brilliant choice! Plus points: gratis early check in, much needed after a 14 hour flight. Staff could not be more helpful, patient and willing, such a nice change! Room was small but practical, spotlessly clean, had everything we could need including an espresso machine, kettle, hairdryer, mini fridge, safe. Bathroom was incredible, HUGE shower, loads of clean fluffy towels, soft bathrobes and plenty of gorgeous toiletries from Kiehls (check out the RRP of these products, they are expensive!) Mini fridge includes FREE bottles of water and juice. Given how much liquid you consume in the heat and the prices in Singapore, this was very much appreciated. Great to be able to set out with a cold bottle in your bag so you don't have to spend the first half hour of your day looking for a shop! Amazingly comfortable bed, despite all the fabulous things to do in Singapore, this bed made it hard to get up in the mornings, it was so comfy! Five minutes walk from the MRT, two stops away from Clarke Quay, the centre of everything in Singapore. Quiet location - because it's off the beaten track slightly (ie not in the middle of the high rises with the other hotels) it's lovely and quiet and we never had trouble with noise. And it's still so close to everything in terms of the MRT so best of both worlds. Pool is lovely, has a whirlpool function too! PLUS we were allowed use a room for a shower before we headed to the airport for our late night flight! I cannot tell you how amazing this was after a days' sightseeing in the heat, we really didn't fancy getting on the place in our grubby sweaty clothes! Cons - not really a huge con but breakfast needed to be replenished more often. We were up early and often the ham and cheese was gone or almost gone. Staff were very obliging and got more when asked, but it would be nice if they kept a closer eye on stocks. Saying that, breakfast generally was plentiful and provided cereal, cooked brekkies, muffins and pastries, salads, steamed dumplings, several different types of bread for toasting. So really it was just the cheese and ham! Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, the staff were so charming and genuinely friendly, nothing was too much trouble, so obliging. And the rates are amazing compared to the prices of other hotels in Singapore. I would recommend choosing a boutique over a massive chain, especially if you want to get a little of the real flavour of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price especially now with the nearby construction”
Reviews.Author: Haleiwamoon
Reviews.Content: Next to the hotel there is an enormous construction project. I am not bothered by daytime noise However the construction goes on all night long. It is incredibly bothersome and I was even more bothered by the fact that the staff here never mentioned it upon arrival. I think they should update their website to inform guests what is going on. Also our bathtub drain did not work and we had to ask them 4 different times to fix it. The food in the restaurant was average yet still overpriced. Was expecting better from this hotel after reading all the positive reviews. I would definitely find out if construction is ongoing before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location, but not one of my favorites..”
Reviews.Author: tzaziki
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in September, after staying 2 nights at Marina Bay Sands. The hotel is a nice, but seems to be missing something. I can't really tell you why, the staff is friendly, the rooms are good size, and good location in chinatown with lots of restaurants and an MRT only 200m away. We stayed at a similar design-hotel in Göteborg, Sweeden in June, and we loved it! We would definatly stay there again, but here, i don't think so. Sorry Majestic! Maybe it was the great stay at Marina Bay Sand that made this not so great, I don't know. To summarize: Positive: Great location, friendly, helpfull staff, free non alcoholic beverages in the minibar. The shower and Kiehls products and the supersoft bathroobe.The room had windows that could open, that was nice, and we were allowed to smoke. Negative: The cleaning of the room could be better. The room were missing that perfect finish after the renovation. Pigeons were drinking of the pool, not nice, i didn't swim there. (But it seemed clean.) I booked the hotel from hotels.com, and I thought it was difficult to understand witch room who had the bathtub and the garden/balcony(?) make sure you get the right room! Our room was covered from floor to ceiling with mirrors, looks cool, but a little disruptive.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, gorgeous service.”
Reviews.Author: kamonkids
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel for one night on the way through to Australia from Europe. We arrived into Singapore at 6am, after the 12 hour flight from Italy, and the reception was gorgeous. The staff explained that the room I had booked (premier pool room) was not available yet, so they had upgraded us to a premier garden room, the one with the bath outside. Since we had a 4am departure the next day, they also said that we had two options for breakfast - we could either have a pre-packed breakfast to take with us to the airport, or we could have it on our first morning instead. We opted to have it straight away, and it was lovely - eggs and bacon cooked to order, coffee to order, plus a range of cereals, pastries, fresh fruit, asian style vegetables, and juices etc. The room was lovely - a very fresh-feeling space decorated in green and white. Perfectly clean, and the bed was heavenly! The nespresso machine is a nice touch, but unfortunately I couldn't get it to work - this could be the jet lag rather than the machine! The mini bar has free non alcoholic beverages, which is nice. The pool is lovely if small, and the lobby and restaurant areas are both beautifully designed. The hotel is in Chinatown, very handy for shopping and eating there, and quite close to the MTR for getting anywhere else in Singapore. All in all I loved this hotel, but what made it for me was the staff - they were just like Singapore itself - warm, friendly and helpful. Five stars, New Majestic!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, staff very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Debbie K
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in early September as two couples in two different rooms. While the rooms we had were small (pool view rooms) their funkiness made up for it. The in-room Nespressos were very much appreciated as were the terrific showers. The hot water in our room didn't last long but no matter as it was quite refreshing to have a tepid shower anyway. The staff were exceptionally friendly and thoughtful, the location was fabulous with an MRT only 200m away and it is in an interesting area. Easy walking distance to Chinatown. The pool view rooms were very quiet and we all slept well. Breakfast was terrific with a mix of styles and the dining room staff were also very friendly. We ate in the restaurant one night. The food was delicious but a bit on the pricey side. Would I stay here again? Definitely. One caution- mind the sharp tiles on the swimming pool. Their rough edges caused my daughters expensive swimmers to rip.

Reviews.Title: “Great for couples, not for young family”
Reviews.Author: LifeSurfer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great boutique hotel set in Chinatown area, just in front of the hotels are a line of Karaoke parlors, restaurants and other entertainments on old colorful old buildings. MRT station is also located only a few hundred meters away, along with the famous Chinatown food street. The inside concept is also a blend of classic chinese with ultra modern touch, which we loved. Our room was covered from floor to ceiling with mirrors (one of them is the hidden door to the bathroom) and the bathtub was outside in the garden. Full blown modern equipments including big LCD screen, Bose stereo, modern shower system, and Nespresso machine as a nice surprise. They also have a great and complete small fitness room. My only comments was their average (and poor choices) breakfast (but I think that's always the case with boutique hotels), small pool, and overall not-for-children experience. We took our 3 and 6 years old, even though they were having a blast but the bed was too high & the breakfast selection was too limited. Great for couples though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel in a beautiful setting . . .”
Reviews.Author: Asperger_Singapore
Reviews.Content: 1. Location: Located in the heritage zone of Chinatown, it is set amidst other gorgeously restored shophouses; in a very pretty district, indeed! Easy access to food, MRT station, shopping areas (mall and street), tourist sights / sites and clubs. Location-wise, it couldn't get any better than this. 2. Hotel: A beautifully restored conservation building, the interior is filled with interesting furniture. Apparently, the chairs are from the personal collection of the owner. 3. Rooms: Well-decorated with all the amenities of any modern hotel. The room I had has an outdoor bathtub - a huge luxurious bathtub. The nespresso machine and free drinks was a nice touch that made staying in the room even better than it already was. 4. Amenities: Small pool but again, nicely done up; great for a soak. Free wifi available. 5. Restaurant: Breakfast was simple but the fare offered was delicious. No chance to try out other meals there, though. 6. Staff: Everyone I met was simply wonderful; which helped made the stay even better. 7. Other comments: If there is one drawback - which is really not the fault of the hotel - is that there is a construction nearby. Although work was done within limited hours, it still precluded a late sleep-in. After that is done, things will be perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: asrightasrain
Reviews.Content: I only got stay one night here due to a bit of illness. However, the staff could not have been nicer in that short while. They show a real genunine concern for my recovery and were fantastic in helping me to get to a colleague to travel back home. The room was that hip cool that is usually missing in most Singapore hotels, even the boutique ones. It had even had a neon light in it. Some people have complained about the noise outside. I am a light sleeper and did not hear a thing all night. Even with my usual earplugs, I am typically awakened at some point in a hotel. The hotel is also very close to the very awesome Maxwell Road Hawker Centre. This is the place to get Hainan Chicken Rice above all others. I missed out on this trip. But next time I will be back at the hotel and right there for the food. Thanks again to all for you understanding and support.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: abigail04
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after a fortnight in Bali/Lombok, and it provided a lovely end to the trip. The staff are friendly and attentive. The hotel is well designed: it has some great art, and the rooms are fun (though really quite wacky). Our room was small, but the space was brilliantly managed so it didn't feel cramped, and it had a large window with views over the pool garden which really helped The bed was very comfortable indeed! They offer free wifi, and some of the mini bar (such as soft drinks, coffee, and the like) were also free. The restaurant was very good, though the menu was confusing - it was hard to tell whether the dishes were main courses in themselves, or whether they were to be shared, and indeed whether they came with rice, etc. To be honest, I'm not sure the restaurant themselves knew how they wanted you to eat the courses! In the end, we would order one each, and rice, *and* share them - neither one thing nor the other. Breakfast - complete with all the char sui buns one could eat - was excellent! The location is great for tourism. My only criticism is regarding air conditioning. Each room has a panel, but it can in fact only be controlled from the front desk - so if you want the a/c off, you need to call down (which, in the middle of the night, didn't really seem like an option). The room got a bit frosty as a result! New Majestic, if you're listening, please let guests turn off their own a/c!

Reviews.Title: “The Power of One”
Reviews.Author: PilgrimPiper
Reviews.Content: We checked in for an overnight stop at the end of nine weeks of travel. We were not happy with our room, as work was being done on the hotel and we had not been told. We got grumpy more quickly than we would have normally. It was our last stop. Abby on reception stepped in. She upgraded us, she showed us how to use speakers and coffee machines, she suggested things to do, she smiled endlessly. And we perked up. And we saw where we were. It's fantastic. A design wonderland in a sensational corner of town. Human scale neighborhood with lots of young designers and foodies opening businesses in shop houses. The hotel itself is a fantasy containing thirty individual fantasy rooms. We got to see four of them and they were all extraordinary. But without Abby's tireless good cheer, we might never have opened our eyes. Needless to say, the staff are fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “We love it!”
Reviews.Author: Jennychong
Reviews.Content: - Great location to China town, restaurants and pubs - The room is beautifully decorated - The buffet breakfast is superb - Friendly and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel in Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: TThynell
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights with kids. The rooms are not that suitable for family of four. We stayed at one of the attic suites. The space was very differend. For our needs the two bathtubs right in the middle of the room were somewhat useless and took a lot of the living space. Hotel has a nice secluded pool which was perfert for our needs. The pool is located on top of the restaurant and if you dive you can see the restaurant through the windows at the bottom of the pool! OK restaurant. Very good location if you want to visit Chinatown. Just a few minutes walk and you're there in the middle of the buzz. Friendly staff, but not very proactive, I must admit.

Reviews.Title: “Junior lifestyle loft is suitable for small sized individual.”
Reviews.Author: Powerpeach
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel previously at the premier garden room. Love it, especially the outdoor bathtub. Hence this yr, decided to be different and chose a junior loft lifestyle room. The room is small and the bed is located "upstairs" where i have to climb a small flight of stairs to get to it. Not exactly recommended for those bigger in size or having knee problems. The room is not as roomy as the premier garden. I didnt have the wow factor when i enter the room, since i was here the second time, probably i was expecting more. Nonetheless, the amenities were good. they even gave us two bottles of singapore sling as complimentary when they knew it's my friend's birthday. That was a nice touch. (: breakfast in the hotel was kinda disappointing. I would expect a more variety from a 4* boutique hotel and from my point of view, the hotel seems to be cutting cost. Not sure if it's true, just my two cents worth. Should u choose this hotel, do pick the premier garden room n above. Otherwise, you might be as disappointed as i am.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: VivienTO
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the quirky details and excellent ammenities (coffeeeee) of New Majestic. I didn't mind staying indoors when it rained heavily on Saturday. A minor disappointment was the hotel didn't have the channel that carried the French Open nor NBA finals. The staff was very accommodating to my husband's requests (had to have documents printed, on the spot taxi call,etc.). I personally found the cleaning staff efficient, and friendly (always with a ready smile).

Reviews.Title: “Very Unique! Enjoyed taking bath on the private veranda!”
Reviews.Author: tamacita
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Goldfish room which was wonderful. The room was very small but there are lots of shelves. The sink is open to the room and the toilet and shower are each in frosted glass enclosures---might not be acceptable to some people. We had free internet; stuff to make tea or coffee and a refrigerator. The room and hotel were spotless. As a bonus all of the bath products are Kiehl's. The breakfast includes a buffet of pastries, breads, fruit, dumplings, rice, plus eggs/sausage or bacon made to order. It was easy for us to get to the Botanical Gardens; Little India; the Sands; and walk to China town. The hotel staff was very helpful with directions and transportation. The hotel is about a block from the entrance to the subway and we used it to get to the airport .

Reviews.Title: “recommended”
Reviews.Author: jackie0911
Reviews.Content: I stayed at lifestyle room. The room is quite spacious compare with other hotel at the same rate, which is the main reason I choose this hotel. Bed is so comfortable with thick bed topper. Espresso machine is a great in-room facility.Good location, Near subway and only few minutes walk to china town. The disadvantage is noise from the road. They provide us ear plug! It seems okay to ease the problem they could not solved. Bathtub is in the middle of the room with only one side blind, so it is not recommended for friends or family with teenager :) Breakfast served with limited variety.

Reviews.Title: “Cool!!!”
Reviews.Author: ElBierto
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect and the room design is very cool. Thank you to all the staff, everybody was very kind and pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Funky Rooms, Great Food”
Reviews.Author: christine_mcmaster
Reviews.Content: Arrived late after a flight from Kathmandu so fell in love with the pristine rooms, great showers and room service. Although there had been a mistake with our booking the staff went out of their way to meet our needs. They helped us plan our tours and organised everything we asked for. We were also very appreciative of being allowed to use a room to shower after a hot sweaty day touring Singapore before our late flight home.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem ....”
Reviews.Author: mirsta
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with partner for 4 nights and in simple words , loved it! The New Majestic is a very modern hotel , trendy design, clean and branded. The design is just amazing - from the Lobby area , small pool ( with three windows in the bottom that look onto the restaurant ) to the rooms.Yes ,the rooms are small , but the design of the rooms and ideas how to use a small space is just amazing. Very nice bathrooms. Great touches - Nespresso maschine in the room, complimentary soft drinks, Khiels bath products and very nice breakfast. We've enjoyed it and would definitely recommend it ....

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Miwa_75
Reviews.Content: I came here for business trip in January and frankly speaking I was rather skeptical staying at a boutique hotel. But how wrong I was, I was approached and greeted by a friendly staff who helped me with the luggage. I stayed at this really posh blue room which is so different from the standard generic design. I then found out from the hotel staff that each room has unique design. Though my stay is very brief but i thoroughly enjoyed my stay. One drawback is maybe due to the limited space, the room is a bit small but its ok for me for me as I am small built. Seriously I feedback to the staff who booked me at this hotel that I would love to come back but I will want to have another room with different design this time.

Reviews.Title: “Very good bath and interesting room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the room is a bit small, But all the things are there. The outdoor iron bathtub is amazing... I had a really great shower also. Nespresso machine is a must-try, very interesting. Cable tv choices are limited, if have more movie channels will be great.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel that offers great value”
Reviews.Author: mcoopersmith
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a holiday in Singapore as I had to travel there for business. We didn't want to stay at the conference hotel for our entire trip but wanted to stay in a nice place. The New Majestic reminds me of a W hotel, as it's very modern, trendy design, clean and branded. They offer Khiels bath products, breakfast and open mini bar except for the alcohol. The pool is small but nice. There are three windows in the bottom that look onto the restaurant. The hotel is in south chinatown which is super convenient. I'm used to 5 star hotels and would rank this one 4.5. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: tasiwaffle
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an Aqua Room during our nights at this hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful, from the moment we checked in to the moment we left. Great location with many wonderful eating spots just up the road in Chinatown, and an MRT station right next door. There was a little bit of street noise at night (something out of the hotel's control), but this generally didn't go to very late. The room was fantastic, roomy, clean and had a nice feel about it. Free water, soft drink and juice in the mini bar and a Nespresso machine - a great touch! Smoking is allowed on the balcony. Just don't turn off the switch labeled "heater" - that is for the hot water!!!! I would definitely recommend this hotel for a stay in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: welltravelled039
Reviews.Content: I would say this hotel was just "OK" the staff where friendly and willing to help. The problem being that their English wasn't good. I wouldn't return, but they did provide excellent shower/bath products. No connection with the hotel, Andre's resturant by the side of the hotel is TRULY WONDERFUL.

Reviews.Title: “Complete disappointment”
Reviews.Author: SerenaCapeTown
Reviews.Content: Totally overpriced, bad location, terrible food, hallways smelled of hospital-like detergent, impossibly tiny rooms. Left after a few hours, but I still had to pay for two full nights. Wrote two letters of complaint, never got a response.

Reviews.Title: “Room Service”
Reviews.Author: Sagittarius_7
Reviews.Content: An interesting and unusual hotel. Funky rooms are attractive and creative. The restaurant is good although the breakfast is basic. The bar just across the road is upmarket and makes up for the fact the hotel doesn't have one. Chinatown market is a few minutes walk and the Outram Park MRT is two minutes away. The proximity to Chinatown introduces another element...one of the staff members accurately described it as a 'party' hotel and this was clearly evident through the wall of my room . Personally I would not return but I think they are aiming at a younger clientele than myself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but areas for improvement”
Reviews.Author: TSPerspective
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for 5 nights I think as a Business travel I would not go back - the boutiqueyness of the hotel is charming at first but lacking the small things that a business traveler needs starts to add up over a few days. For example, only one device can be connected at a time to their internet - so good luck syncing something from your CPU to your phone without a log-out dance between devices. There really is no desk area to speak of so getting work done in the room is not comfortable. Lastly my room lost all power on my last day there so they had to transfer me into a new room - a sign that they are still a bit amateurish. The service from the front desk was fine but I never felt like they were going out of my way to make my stay the most amazing it could be. For the high prices they charge, I expect better. The location is not bad - in Chinatown which has a certain charm to it. Nice for walking around and close to the Maxwell food center which provided a few tasty meals for me. While some boutique hotels I'd call Sexy - this one is a bit more quaint and quirky.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, immature service”
Reviews.Author: cw35
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel, with an interesting pool in the courtyard. The appeal is that each room is unique. If you go, ask to see a couple different rooms so you can pick. The one weakness is the young staff at the front desk. They're a functional group, but can't answer any questions or provide any guidance outside of the core offerings that the hotel provides.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in a unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: GR_Canberra
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel, great décor a small but immaculate room with nice additional touches such as the in-room nespresso machine and the i-pod charger. I have stayed in Singapore before and while you can find cheaper accommodation in the big 4 & 5 star hotels, this was very unique and a little hint of old Singapore without going to the massive prices at Raffles The hotel is very close to the Metro and Chinatown, the staff were very helpful and the pool (although small) is a wonderful addition to a Boutique hotel. My wife and I enjoyed our visit immensely and we will be back again

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_was_a_horse
Reviews.Content: The main reason I booked this hotel was that I wanted to try the Attic Suite because of the twin bath tub arrangement. Unfortunately, I came to discover the bath tubs are simply for show. I was able to get one tub half full with lukewarm water--started hot but soon ran cold. There was absolutely no more hot water. To reiterate, there was not even enough hot water to get one tub half full of hot water let alone both. I called the front desk and they explained to me that the building's hot water heater is not capable of heating enough water for more than half of one tub under ideal circumstances. Maybe potential customers should be made aware of this before booking. This was a huge disappointment. Advertising particular amenities, charging a substantial premium, and then not actually providing what was advertised and agreed upon is...well, there's word for it. I paid enough money to book a room at any number of 5 star hotels in Singapore. I did not get what I paid for. My personal experience varies so greatly from previous reviews that I am not entirely confident in their validity.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjones1881
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel only let down by the fact that there is currently a building site next door. This is hardly their fault yet it mean't being woken up early by drilling going on next door. Other than that it was an almost perfect stay. When we arrived they had no record of our booking, but the staff did not bat an eyelash. They asked us to sit down for a couple of minutes while they sorted out an upgrade for us. The room was stunning, amazing shower and bathtub, and incredibly comfortable bed. Great coffee machine and free soft drinks. The only problem was there was a rainstorm one night, which caused rain to drip very loudly on the railing on the balcony, keeping us awake. This could be easily sorted with some guttering. The breakfast was very good and the staff were endlessly friendly and helpful. The pool was nice, if very cold (not too bad considering how hot it was in Singapore). And the location was excellent, just next to the MRT and China Town. An excellent hotel I would definitely stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic, reasonably priced option in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: fg207
Reviews.Content: This place is great. Cheaper rooms are quite small, but the price reflects that. They are brilliantly designed, however, and everything in them is of superb quality. The beds are great, flat screen tvs, Nespresso machine worked very well and each room has its own unique design. Cue my wife bouncing on the bed being photographed with the amazing mural behind her. The staff are incredibly nice and helpful. There is also an amazing Chinese fusion restaurant downstairs. Fantastic foie gras-based starter, one of the best ever. Breakfast also included in that restaurant, very good indeed. A great place to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “If you prefer Boutique, this place is for you”
Reviews.Author: RotaryAl
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the New Majestic during our visit to Singapore to see the Grand Prix. Most of what we had read about the place both good and bad was true to a certain extent. Were the rooms small, well yes but perfectly appointed with a high attention to detail which made every room individual. We arrived late at night and the staff couldn't have been more welcoming. we were checked in efficiently and shown to our room before being pointed in the direction of some excellent nearby bars to sooth the jet lag. The rooms were perfectly comfortable and the bed simply sucked you in with a comfortable mattress and soft feather pillows. The breakfast was great for choice and there was plenty of choice. Would I stay there again..certainly

Reviews.Title: “5Star boutique! Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: 2WorldtravellersSYD
Reviews.Content: Just had a excellent 4 night stay at the New Majestic and enjoyed it to the fullest! Small but uebercool rooms, very functional and filled with light (stayed at Poolroom) the free wireless works easily, the complimentary beverages are a great add on and my rate included breakfast which kicked of the day nicely. Staff is very kind and helpful. A boutique hotel with 5Star quality. Will certainly go again!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky!”
Reviews.Author: sal101160
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 or 5 nights in April this year. Reception is excellent and the staff very friendly. Always greeting you as you come and go and offering any assistance etc. The room was fantastic - they each have different designs. The range of toiletries was very good, the robes excellent and housekeeping looked after the rooms at least twice a day - replenishing coffee etc. as necessary. Apart from breakfast I didn't eat at the hotel. But would recommend it without hesitation and the area is quite peaceful also. My room was very small but perfectly adequate - no doubt due to space premiums in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, vibrant and tasteful.”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Amy_Lam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a minibreak on our trip over to the UK from Australia. found the new majestic through a google search for nice hotels in Singapore. I was delighted to find something just a little special in SIngapore. Perfect. Booked. We were welcomed very warmly by the hotel staff. Nothing was too much trouble. The room selected was delightful - East meets West. We had a huge bathtub outside (very refreshing after a long day walking and shopping in Singapore) and a lovely bathroom with Keil's products. The hotel was very clean, tastefully decorated and had a fabulous compact gym. We were very impressed. The staff went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable as possible. It was very conveniently located in Chinatown (great eats nearby). A great place to stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “too many great rooms, not enough nights!”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: I LOVED the New Majestic - my wife and I stayed for 3 nights and tried a different room each night. We could easily have stayed another 10 without being bored. My favourite was the Attic Room, with side-by-side retro deep-soak baths (great for watching early morning world cup matches from!). Check out www.neilsonparc.com for a more complete review.

Reviews.Title: “A quirky fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jojo0821
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights to end our honeymoon, the staff were incredilbly helpful and even upgraded our room when I woke up in the morning covered in an alarming number of mosquito bites, without even being asked. We cannot fault the location, rooms or quality that this hotel provides, it is quirky with a bath outside so be prepared for something a bit novel as every room is different.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Al_Sydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in May and loved New Majestic. Service is exceptional. Pradeep, the Guest Services Executive was so helpful when we checked in and out. Top marks. Hotel has a great design. Rooms are modern, well designed and comfortable. Free wireless internet is very good. Stayed in a Garden Room which has a terrace and outdoor bath which was really nice. Hotel is in a very good location to MRT and China Town. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “nice for 3 days transit breakaway”
Reviews.Author: RnWSydney
Reviews.Content: (+) - Shower vanities modern - nice bed, bed linen, bathrobe - nespresso machine - give us many bottle water and 1 juice. - nice pool view but no one swims - close to MRT station. - Staffs are helpfull, pretty and nice. - we still on honeymoon season - we feel want to stay more. (-) - no Bath - room is small, bedroom, bathroom. - breakfast is not much variety, but nice food - tv not many channel

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Cammy_T
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights from June 13 - 15 and highly recommend this little gem of a hotel! Nestled in a convenient location in Chinatown, close to a MRT station and a short train ride away from most sites and malls, everything from the service, cleaniness and room comfort was first class. We arrived very early from our flight and was offered a room upgrade and early check-in as our pre-booked room was not ready, which we accepted given the reasonable rate. The room was cozy, clean and comfortable for 2 people and tastefully decorated - we felt at home right away! I had read many reviews here praising the customer service at NMH prior to booking and can definitely verify that it's first class! From the check-in staff and bellhops to the restaurant staff and cleaners - excellent service with a smile. I would especially like to praise Pradeep for his friendly welcome and going above & beyond to make our stay a memorable one - thanks Pradeep. We will definitely be coming back to this little gem on our next visit to Singapore! Cameron & Alastair

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: KyleYC
Reviews.Content: tastefully decorated rooms with fantastic facilities, Bright, spacious and modern, What makes our stay memorable is the courtsey and the helpfulness of the staff. They learnt our names during the first day and addressed us by our names through out our stay. Whenever we needed any information about Singapore, they responded immediately and accurately, with a smile. We like a small hotel since all the facillities are so close by. There is no long hallway to walk to our room. We went up to the roof top where there is a bar. The view is quite gorgeous, and the setting is very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel close to MRT, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ladybug067
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in a premier garden room for one week in March and found the room to be modern & had very comfortable bed & linen. The rooms were not large but were designed to make most of the space. The outdoor bath was fantastic. The rooms were cleaned spotlessly & regularly. The swimming pool was small but very nice. The staff were friendly and very accommodating. The location was only a couple of minutes walk to the MRT, and was only a couple of stops away from Clarke Quay. Only criticism would be regarding the beer fridge which did not keep things cold at all. Breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Design * Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mw0815
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in March 2010 for a couple of days. The hotel was perfect in every way. Cool design hotel, very clean. The staff couldn't be better, very helpful and always friendly! Breakfast was great and everything fresh - although no big selection (definitely prefer the quality and freshness of the food!). Great location, middle of Chinatown, underground station just round the corner and lot of sights in walking distance. Would definitely recommend the hotel and would stay there again. If you are not staying on your own, then take the larger rooms. Free local calls, free internet, free water, free Nespresso machine on the room ... what else do you need?!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - definately worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: PushkinExpatinBaku
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in one of the attic rooms which is a little larger than some of the other rooms. When we checked out we had a full day in Singapore with a late night flight, we used one of the Garden rooms to have a shower before travelling and this room was small so recommend the Attic Room (unless you don't like climbing ladders to get into bed). We found the staff extremely helpful in recommending places to visit and eat. They would also look up particular places for us on the internet (for example we were looking for a pet shop to buy some treats for our kittens which we cannot get in Baku) and they found pet shops for us and printed out google maps - great service. We did eat in hotel restaurant one night which we enjoyed and again the staff were very helpful in making recommendations. My husband tried the dukian pudding based on the recommendation and did not like it (the dukian is not for everyone) and they gave him another dessert free of charge. The hotel is very close to Outram Park MRT station so very easy to get around the city. We would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “The New Majestic, the place to stay in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Max0678
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent a month travelling around South East Asia taking in Hong Kong, Vietnam, Cambodia and Thailand. Before returning home, we visited Singapore and I was given a treat, a stay at the New Majestic! Although Singapore is not the World's most liveliest at night, The New Majestic, definitely is one of the World's best hotel's! Stylish and comfortable with unique rooms. The staff were friendly and helpful 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Hustavenes
Reviews.Content: The room we were offered upon arrival was so small and without a window, so we upgraded to a suite. The suite was nice, with two bath tubs in the center of the room. The room was nice, but there was hardly any daylight from the small windows in the ceiling. The bed and bed linen was fantastic. We missed a lobby bar, and the ability to regulate the air condition on our own. If you wanted the AC to be turned off, you had to call front desk. Staff at det front desk was friendly and helpful, but staff at the restaurant was absent minded at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: GunaySen
Reviews.Content: New Majestic Hotel is located in Chinatown which was a walking distance to the Chinese New Year attractions. The hotel is small, but very polite service. The room is not spacious but good enough for a couple days. Towels,linens and utensils are perfect. You feel like you are at home! The lobby of the hotel is an art piece! You must see! The restaurant in the hotel is out of this world! Excellent Chinese! Room rates are great for the service..I prefer to stay there instead of a big,huge hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Captivating first impression but lacks practicality”
Reviews.Author: chreong
Reviews.Content: stayed one of the rooms for one night during my trip to singapore. Excellent staff all the way from arrival to check in. The brief on how to use the facilities in the room is extensive and impressive! The room given was untitled but designed as all white and with bare finishings! Such as the bulb without lampshades, painted flooring and walls. Certain walls are left bare just cement texture. It was interesting during the first few minutes, but after a while, the room lacks practicality. The bathroom is in the center with glass walls all round without any blinds. Bathing takes center stage!! unless you are an exhibitionist, you would feel a bit intimidated even staying alone. the bath tub, wardrobe, basin and WC are located separately so you cannot move from one point to another effortlessly. You'd have to brush your teeth in the basin, then walk over to WC for deposit and then walk to the bath tub for bathing!! It is like the whole room is the bathroom..... The work table is so small and only one plug point which is used by a lamp. Strangely enough, there are a lot of extra plug points in other parts of the room, but not by the work table!! strange...

Reviews.Title: “not kool”
Reviews.Author: noseknows
Reviews.Content: very synthetic without warmth breakfast cost the owner 25 cents rooms miniscule and noisy

Reviews.Title: “interesting designs, great facilities and nice services”
Reviews.Author: selenechong
Reviews.Content: the first impression was from the lobby. a little bit messy but funky and warm. the staffs were very nice and helpful. both english and chinese could be used. the room was small but comfortable. each room has unique design. we saw all the room avaliable first and chose which one we stayed. the room was clean and the facilities were luxury, especially the outside bathtub. it was great and we spent a romantic night there. also the location was wonderful. just 2 minute's walk to the taxi stop and underground station. 5 minute's walk to the food centre. for the hotel is in the end of a quiet alley filled with some romantic bars, the location was quite nice. but the hotel room was not good of sound insulation. i heard someone laughing at the early morning. maybe it was the only disappointed spot of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel with All the Luxuries One Would Want”
Reviews.Author: Trebs1
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay in a Premier Garden Room last December 19-20. Reception was friendly and warm and we were able to check in at 12NN even though the stated time was still at 3PM. We were even allowed to peek at several room options before we settled for our room (the one with the goldfish). Room was a bit small but had all of the luxuries that one would want. Particularly liked the cast iron outdoor tub (although the hot water runs out before the tub would fill) and the extremely comfortable bed, linens, and towels. Room service was fast and efficient, and most of all, intuitive. Having seen how much of the large sized coffee pods we were consuming, they automatically placed extra pods of that size on the 2nd day. Also, we were unable to make it in time for breakfast (the bed is very difficult to leave!), they still made a plate of fruits and bread for us to enjoy at the lobby lounge. Overall, a luxurious experience enhanced by charming, personalized service. Can't wait to try out the other rooms the next time I visit!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: nlsbstn
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Positive: - very close (2 min walk) to the nearest MRT-station - beautiful designed - excellent service (we had the possibility (at no charge) to take a shower at the end of the day before we went to the airport for our late in the evening flight) Negative: - The finishing of our room was not that great. From a distance it all looks very sophisticated, but at a closer look you see that the constructor didn't put his best men at work - No internet (iMac?) at our room. Get rid of the Philips tv's and install Apple computers!

Reviews.Title: “Walking on a dream”
Reviews.Author: MR_Gsas
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the perfect escape this is it! I loved everything about this place, it is by far the most perfect hotel that singapore has to offer. The location is great, Handy to Clark Quay.... though you will find it very difficult to motivate your self to leave the room - Everything is quality, i cant stress this enough! Once you lay down on the bed, you will know what heaven feels like. The rooms were so Clean, and i noticed every time we did leave the room the staff would do an amazing job of cleaning it up, and topping up the free mini-bar. This doesn't just happen once daily like most hotels, they make a constant effort through out the day. Everything from the bath salts to the Nespresso machine in the room is Top Quality, The iron cast bath is big enough for two, with plenty of hot water to fill it up. The room we stayed in was a lifestyle room, We choose the Mirror suit (I Have been working abroad so haddn't seen my partner in a couple of months) It was fantastic! not the least bit tacky, Pure elegance, Very sensual from the lighting to the layout.... You will notice the staff will go out of their way to make sure you enjoy your stay, Being only a small boutique hotel it makes the experience all the more intimate and will leave you smiling when they remember your name on your return visit. There is so much i could go on about this place, the Art, the pool, the gym, the Bar, the people..... but i wont ruin it for you, ill let you experance what i did for yourself. I will tell you now, if you are the sort of person who prefers to escape the madness of orchard road, the bland uniform hotels and their chain like fashion - The New MAJESTIC hotel is for you!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST... ever.”
Reviews.Author: GregLin
Reviews.Content: So much of traveling is the people you meet along the way. The staff of the New Majestic Hotel are such memorable people. From stepping out of the taxi, to leaving for the airport at the end of our stay, the gals and guys working there were the most genuinely enthusiastic, cheerful, helpful and welcoming gang that we've ever experienced in many years of traveling. Please just keep doing what you're doing ! It's Working ! We want to move in permanently to be close to our new family (Deine, Vim and the boys at the front desk) ! Oh yeah, Cozy Boutique Rooms, Great Location, Tasty Breakfast included... Very Romantic !!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel with fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: Debbie097
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 days at this hotel, and it was absolutely fantastic ! The staff were amazing, and went far beyond and above expectations. The room was brilliant, the outdoor bath excellent, the bathrobes amazing and so on. The location is also really convenient, and it is easy to walk to most of the sights and also good areas for a night out. Top hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Funky”
Reviews.Author: koroua
Reviews.Content: Three of us went for a de-stressing time and were fabulously delighted. Each of us had a different room type (our choice) and all were fantastic. Also had a look at many of the other rooms - hard to pick the one I like best. The staff are wonderful and could not do enough for us (even when we asked for th odd requests). Really close to the MRT which makes it easy to move around Singapore. We appreciated the little touches the most, like the free bottled water which we could then take with us each day when we went outside and the absolutely fabulous bathrobes. Am going to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Unique rooms, friendliest staff, comfortable, great design, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nenamandarina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New Majestic at the beginning of our holiday and at the end before returning to London. First time we stayed in one of the garden rooms with the outdoor cast iron bath, we loved it! The room was quirky and fun, but without sacrificing comfort. The linen super soft, the softest bathrobes ever, and Kielh's toiletries. The staff were all incredibly friendly and the breakfast adecuate. On our departure first time around, we didn't have to jump on the plane until the evening but were checking out in the morning, we asked for a late check out and what we got was even better, we were allowed to come back to the hotel after exploring the city and have a shower, which was great! We had the shower in one of the loft rooms which was in two levels, again different and very cool. We liked the hotel and the experience so much that at the end of our holiday we spent another night before flying back to the UK. This time we had a lifestyle room, we saw three, all very different and cool, went for the one called "Untitled". It was the dream room that one would like to have at home, white, great lighting and cool furniture, loved it!! Definitely one of my favorite hotels. Great design, great staff, great unique rooms and very comfortable. I'd definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, quirky, funky hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Queenpugh
Reviews.Content: What a wicked time we had at the New Majestic. Great location in a trendy part of Chinatown with some great bars especially the hotels! The area has a similar vibe to Shoreditch/Hoxton in London. The hotel has the most amazing staff especially Zairi and Pradeep who were so helpful All the rooms are individually decorated by a designer and are fabulous, I urge you to check out the pictures on the website. The biggest and most comfy bed ever, iPOD docking station, great breakfast included, great toiletries - Kielhs and a balcony over the street. Oh and free internet in the lobby on one of the hotels laptops. How cool is that. NB however that some of the rooms share a warm with the banging bar next door so could be noisy but we were told of this when choosing a room but overlooks a quiet street with little traffic. Can't wait to go back....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: tizibcn
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a lot of details in the room like free wifi, free Nespressos, ipod dock, outdoor bath tub... Well located next to the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Chic”
Reviews.Author: mattag
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Individually designed rooms provide quirky surprises! Funky pool

Reviews.Title: “We felt really welcome”
Reviews.Author: Tropfan
Reviews.Content: This is a remarkable hotel. A modern approach in the middle of chinatown, a good mixture of values. We loved the modern decoration, but most of all we loved the staff at the reception: friendly, competent, attentive, joyfull, very refreshing! Clean is not strong enough a word to describe the state of the (bath)room and (bed)linen. And all objects in the rooms of quality brands. Our only note is that breakfast could be better. But as we have enjoyed Singapore very much, we are already looking forward to stay with the New Majestic again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: Ullans
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was on the quieter edge of Chinatown and it was recommended by Wallpaper*. The staff were very welcoming on arrival and this continued throughout my stay. i was particularly pleased when they offered me a room (at no extra cost) to shower and freshen up in after I checked out as I had a midnight flight from Singapore. The hotel has a good fitness centre and a nice, small pool. The hotel's bar makes a good stop before exploring the neighbourhood restaurants. A great antidote to the big chain hotels that dominate Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for- LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: BrookMeakins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went back and forth when trying to decide on a hotel for our quick, two day stopover in Singapore. We loved the New Majestic instinctually from seeing it so often in our travel and design magazines. But, the reviews on tripadvisor are definitely not what we wanted to see. We knew that Raffles and/or Orchard Road area would be less than appealing for us- we would not think of staying in Times Square when we travel to New York or Union Square in San Francisco, so we always try to stay away from the touristy/shopping areas when choosing a hotel.
