However, that left us with few options. Although the Naumi's location wasn't great for what we were looking for, that was our other option- it seemed like a great boutique option, and the reviews are great. However, something kept drawing us back to the New Majestic. In the end, we are so glad we chose the New Majestic! It was exactly what we were looking for. The detailing in this hotel is absolutely amazing. We were extremely satisfied with our room- especially for a boutique hotel, the cleanliness throughout the whole hotel, including our room, was excellent. We stayed in a garden room, with the romantic claw foot bath outside. On our last morning we drew up a fantastic bubble bath. The ambiance is just great- I definitely recommend this style of room. The service was excellent- we arrived around two in the morning, and we were still able to have fabulous cocktails at the adjoining bar. Check in was fast and easy. The staff were friendly, accommodating, and charming. Throughout our stay, they answered our questions, made restaurant reservations and recommendations, and were generally very helpful. The pool is amazing- we took pictures of each other from the peep holes in the restaurant, which turned out great! Both days we took a break from the city by lounging at the pool for two hours. The staff complied quickly with our requests for cold beers to be delivered pool side- so refreshing. On both occasions, we were the only guests at the pool. How fun! The breakfast was great- excellent espresso. Gym was great as well. On our last day, they allowed us to store our luggage, then when we got back to the hotel to pick it up, they let us have one last swim, then gave us a room to use to shower and freshen up. We LOVED the location of the hotel- I would have been so disappointed if we stayed in the more commercial center. The street the hotel is on is filled with interesting restaurants, an awesome German wine bar (a must!), cute boutiques, and it's just a three minute walk to amazing Chinatown shops. We loved exploring the area. It really made the trip for us. One final note- our water pressure was amazing in our shower, and we didn't ever run out of hot water, even when we filled our bath. Please, feel free to ask any questions of me- this hotel is fabulous and I would not hesitate to stay there again or recommend it to fellow travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay lived up to our expectations and more.”
Reviews.Author: nbayford
Reviews.Content: Unique hotel with 30 individual rooms. The rooms have some great touches - complimentary doughnuts on arrival. Great tea and coffee facilities. Free soft drinks including water, apple and orange juice. Comfortable elevated bed with nice soft bedding. Great shower with lovely Kiehl's products. Powerful air-conditioning which you need in Singapore. Nice outdoor pool area and gym area. Delicious food including the wasabi chicken and crispy duck. Great cocktails, offers between 5pm – 7pm served in the bar area , a personal favourite - Lychee Martini which comes with a yummy side nibble. On our check out date and with a flight late that evening we were able to leave our luggage with reception who were then kind enough later that day to give us a room where we could freshen up and shower before the long flight home – something you feel you need having spent the last day cramming in everything you wanted to go back to and visit again. Overall one of the best hotels I’ve stayed at to date.

Reviews.Title: “Great room - shame about the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Bobbuild
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our second night in Singapore. Really funky room, small but well equiped with glass cubicles for the shower and loo. Nice pool with portholes in the floor which is above the restaurant. Pity we weren't told that there was a private function so the restaurant was closed - this was part of the reason for staying here. However we went to Ember which is part of Hotel 1929 and had a fabulous meal, can't recommend it highly enough, excellent staff. Would certainly consider staying there next time!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Lobby”
Reviews.Author: HotelEnthusiast09
Reviews.Content: As design focussed hotels go, the lobby of the New Majestic is the business. It's funky, with a great selection of stuff and it's bright, airy and welcoming. The room we stayed in was conceptually interesting but was more about concept than comfort; for example, the design behind the toilet (an almost transparent glass cubicle right in the room) is just daft. The bed was comfortable though and it was thoughtful to have water and macaroons laid out in room for when we checked in on a sweltering day. The shower however ran out of hot water pretty quickly and, if two are to take a shower one after another, the second person doesn't get any hot water at all unless you wait for 20 mins. That's fine in a budget hotel but didn't seem right in what is billed as a style conscious, modern hotel. The corridors look like something that wouldn't be out of place in a conference centre, and the swimming pool is more a shallow plunge pool than a proper pool. Also, the day we got there, the lift was out of order which made for a really hot trudge up and down 4 flights of stairs till they got it working again. All in, seeing as this hotel is featured in several design lists, fine if you want the kudos to say you've stayed somewhere directional in otherwise staid Singapore; as hotels themselves go though, it's style over substance which is fine flicking the pages of a glossy but not a ton of fun if you want to bed down.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best.....in asia.........”
Reviews.Author: Barcelona_boys
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the end of a 3 week tour of asia...our room was fantastic, out door bath and terrace great fun.... very nice touches in the room, nespresso etc.. We got to peek at all of the rooms on our floor, thanks to the friendly housekeeper.. they are all fantastic with individual themes and artwork... Reception team were extra helpful....offering us a room to shower and change in before our departure to the airport late in the evening....after we had checked out in the morning.. The Cocktails at the super chic and trendy bar attached to hotel were fantastic.. Would not hesitate to reccomend..

Reviews.Title: “Unique boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: matgray
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in May 09and enjoyed it immensely with only a few downsides. My room with outside bath was comfy but a little small with no room for suitcase except on the floor or a chair. Room fridge was warm but free soft drinks appreciated. Breakfast was adequate but I found the chairs to be most uncomfortable, they seem to have different chairs in the evening when the meals are delicious. Enough of the negatives, the positives really outweigh them. Friendly, helpful staff everywhere. After this stay I went to St. Regis for 4 days and guess what .... I missed the Majestic. Can't wait to go back next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: bushinesu
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel for a short trip to Singapore but with some restrictions: Positive Impressions: - perfect design of the rooms and the lobby/entrance – it is a cool hotel but like in all hip hotels you have to make compromises - clean bathroom and well equipped rooms (Flat Screen TV with HBO, Nespresso Coffee machine, complimentary Mini-Bar) - friendly staff - very good hotel-bar – cool design and good drinks (cheap happy hour from 5 pm to 9 pm) - only one minute walk from hotel to subway – from the station two lines leave to all directions in Singapore – every attraction is within reach of 10 min; Vivo City only one stop! Negative Impressions: - We had a room in the back of the hotel pointing to the houses on the other side of the small street. All the houses on the other side of the street had directed their air-conditions to the hotel which made a lot of noise. Because the hotel-windows are not very good isolated against noise it was nearly impossible to find comfortable sleep. - Like it was written here before there is not enough warm water for a long shower – if you stay with two persons in the room the second one has to shower with cold water (relating to the price you have to pay for the rooms this is definitely a very bad impression!) The hotel is very nice for a short stay in Singapore but it is not a classical hotel with all services you can expect from an international hotel brand.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the New Majestic, just needs a few tweaks here & there...”
Reviews.Author: kpvtraveller
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the New Majestic Hotel. The rooms are all very different, so be careful when booking. We stayed in a garden room with outdoor tub (obviously on the quiet side - refer to previous reviewer). The room itself was compact but had everything we desired plus we loved the fact each room had been designed by a Singaporean 'emerging' artist. A few days stay would be great, but if you are staying in town for a week (and wish to unpack your suitcase) you may require a bit more room? Welcome mini doughnuts, Kiehls products, Nespresso, Free wireless - all nice welcome touches. Water, juice and soft drinks all included in your room rate. Breakfast was very average, lacking variety, service poor and once items had finished staff never replenished - it pays to get to bfast early! They do offer eggs - when we requested poached we were advised this would be 'too tough" and we could choose from either sunny side or turn over! The area is qaint and atmospheric - I would much prefer to stay in Chinatown than on Orchard Road. Some cool designer shops on Erskine Rd & Ann Siang Road - just a short walk from the hotel. We had a few cocktails (pre dinner) at the Majestic Bar (next door) which were great - happy hour 5 till 8 (I think) and they also serve complimentary finger food.... Didn't get to the bar to see it past 11pm. We dined at the restaurant, even booking in advance (over 5 weeks) our table was basically in the lobby. Service was once again poor (same staff as breakfast), however the food was very very good. We ordered hot & sour soup & full duck - delicious! All in all, a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh design, helpful staff, not cheap, breakfast ok, location ok”
Reviews.Author: NikoPseudo
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel: picked it from the Wallpaper* guidebook for Singapore. Selected it for the bold interior design. Downsides: rooms on the street are noisy. As charming as a balcony on karaoke bar can be, trying to sleep through it at 1am is no fun. Had to turn on a tornado-like fan to cover the noise and, even then... Not impressed. Complementary breakfast is ok, but scarce, with few little pieces of fruit, two different dumplings, miso soup, generic muesli and long-life yoghurt. Location is a little remote, and one has to chip in quite a few cabs to get around, but the neighbouring Chinatown is charming. Upsides: great design, with each room done differently. Quirky washrooms, brilliant complimentary Khiels toiletry, luscious bed linen, complimentary doughnuts and non-alcoholic drinks (wow!). I tried two rooms (after asking to be moved away from the noisy room, and having to pay 90$Sing extra for it). First room was Aqua Suite, with great cube for bath and shower at the center of the room. Second room was a plush 'shag quarter' with wall to wall carpet and floor inset bed. That proved to be a comfy night of sleep, with no noise either from the overlooked pool, or from people walking down the hall. And the website is the best I have ever seen in terms of what you see is what you get; although I was 'upgraded' away from the room I had originally selected... Overall: great design, great crowd. Not planning to make it my Singapore pied-à-terre. Too many other great places to sample, and wouldn't want to gamble an other inadvertent 'upgrade'.

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Tattoosydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New Majestic in August 2008 (yes, I know, I'm just getting around to doing my reviews). We stayed in one of the Attic Suites, which was a really amazing room. On two levels - a large lounge/television room in one half of downstairs, and two huge baths in the other half, and upstairs in the loft one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The steps up to the bed are a little hard to handle when one has been drinking, but otherwise no complaints. The design of the rooms is clever, very cool and extremely well done - there has been no stinting on the cost here. The hotel really does think of everything - free internet, free drinks, a coffee machine that makes very good coffee in the room, wonderful toiletries. The staff, while seemingly a little young and inexperienced, more than made up for that with their friendliness and willingness to help. We were checked in promptly and they always welcomed us back to the hotel when we arrived back from shopping. When we found out that our flight out of Singapore had been cancelled, they organised us a room to stay in incredibly quickly, and then just as quickly and happily cancelled it (without charge) when we found out we had been shifted to a different flight that same night. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant is good and plentiful (if not worldbeating) Add all of that to the wonderful food at the restaurant for dinner, the great cocktails (at the usual Singapore prices unfortunately) at the bar attached to the hotel, and the location close to China Town, and this place is very hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Completely individual - this is what a boutique hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: Journalistontheroad
Reviews.Content: The New Majestic Hotel has all of the elements of a great stay: unique rooms which are also comfortable, relaxed but well-trained staff, and a good location at the bottom of Chinatown. The swimming pool, which has portholes overlooking the dining room, is great fun, and there's an air conditioned fitness room too. This hotel gets all the extras right, with free soft drinks included in the room, free doughnuts to welcome you there, free internet access (and laptops to borrow)...as well as its owner's quirky collection of chairs. If you're a backpacker, this is worth the extra money; if you're here on business or leisure, this will be one hotel you will always remember.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and different”
Reviews.Author: mossleytrippers
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Stayed one night on a stopover. A stone's throw away from Outram Park MRT so we got the MRT to and from the airport. Great if you don't want to stay in an impersonal corporate gaff on Orchard Rd (we're staying in one of those on the way back home!). We arrived at 7.30am and realised we were pushing it to expect to check in at that time, so were told to return at 12.30. We left them with our bags and got the MRT into town. Lovely room - would really recommend spending the extra and getting a "Garden room" - comes with an outside bath on a private terrace which is fun (see picture). Room much smaller than in many other hotels but not a problem when you get used to it. Shower (brill!) and toilet were kind of "in the room" with glass walls which was a bit weird at first - but again this became a bit quirky. Lots of lovely little extras. Don't read older reviews if you want to be surprised of what they are. Good breakfast. We had a really late flight so after we checked out (12 noon) we returned later in the evening and had a shower in one of the rooms, which was really welcome after a day in the Singapore heat. We payed 164 GBP for B& B through Agoda. Wouldn't normally pay this much for a hotel but it was a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: mlddrss
Reviews.Content: My wife just spent 2 night in Singapore's Majestic Hotel. The Majestic is located in Chinatown just 2 minutes from a MRT station, so the location is very convenient. Whether its design appeals to you is matter of taste, we found it amazing. We has a room with an outside bathtub, which is very recommendable. Service is impeccable and we found everything to our liking. But really exceptional is how professional and nice the staff was. One example: Our flight back home was at 11.30pm. so we asked for a late checkout. Unfortunately the room was booked for the next night, so they could only offer us 2pm, So we left our luggage at the hotel and came back to pick it up at 8pm. When we came back they remembered our request and offered us a different room for a shower before we got to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Style and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: iinfoatthe
Reviews.Content: I had some reservations about booking here, as I had on many previous occasions stayed at the Fullerton. These were swiflty got rid of on check in, by the very friendly and helpful staff whom made my stay exceptional. The bed room was compact, but contained everything that was needed. The bathroom outside was fabulous, and the general design very good. Some of the finishing were a touch tired, and there were some general maintenance problems. Food was excellent, and much enjoyed, as the Bar was of a high standard

Reviews.Title: “Charming and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pipawik
Reviews.Content: Those looking for a stylish and comfortable hotel in Singapore won't go wrong with the New Majestic. I was there for a conference and all of my colleagues and I liked our rooms - of course they were all different. I was in a room with a loft bed (forget the name) - it was small but very well laid out and perfectly comfortable for one. Right near the heart of Chinatown, but out of the fray, and very close to a subway stop, so easy, easy, easy access to all areas. I made it to Little India and Raffles in minutes. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Still great but getting old...”
Reviews.Author: Arturas
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at this hotel. We stayed here for one night. We still like this hotel but the rooms start getting old. You can see stains in the shower, the walls do have scratches so better maintenance is required. And of course, design world does not stands still. There are many new hotels opened with more impressive architecture and interior designs in the last few years. All in all, we highly recommend this hotel for the visitors to Singapore.It is easy to access with metro from Changi airport and other Singapore top attractions are easy to access with metro.

Reviews.Title: “nice aquaroom”
Reviews.Author: chacaldore
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel. clean and furnished with style. We had the Aquaroom, which was amazing with the bath in the middle of the room. Unfortunately it was noisy as we had the view on the street and there is a night club not far from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome outdoor bath - great boutique style”
Reviews.Author: Moscow_traveller
Reviews.Content: Having searched many websites and Trip Advisor, we found the New Majestic as about the only Boutique Hotel in Singapore. Having booked it, we then found some reviews in some high end magazines, so hoped we would not be dissapointed. We were not! We booked a Premier Garden Room (outdoor bath). Whilst there was no view from the terrace (we were no expecting one and I do not think the purpose of an the outdoor bath is not to look at the traffic...), it was in fact a great spot to relax. The room had a big shower with a variety of types of water sprays from the top and the middle of the shower. There was a LCD TV at the foot of the bed and also in the rooms were the most comfortable bath robes ever... (we even tried to purchase one, but, unfortunately they did not have our size). You can reach anything easily in Singapore by Taxi, although, we did fnd ourselves shuffling between the Raffles Plaza area and the Hotel on a few occasions. However, the happiness of staying at a boutuqey style of hotel out won the extra couple of taxi rides. The staff were always helpful and happy. Also, when I asked if I could use the internet I was delighted to be given an Apple MacBook just to borrow, which they said "just bring back when you are finished"! This was perfect as there was WIFI throughout the hotel lobby and in our rooms. We did not use the pool, although only because of a lack of time.... However, it was a cool design in that the bottom of the pool has circular windows over the restaurant! Overall, a great hotel to use as a base! Breakfast was substantial and the room was spotless. The rooms are all themed and we had the big goldfish room (photos attached). It made for an enjoyable stay and we would happily stay there next time in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the unique boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: blv_beetle
Reviews.Content: Although I have read not-so-nice reviews abt this hotel, I've decided to be brave; given that awards this hotel have received. Turns out it was an excellent move! The staffs were absolutely brilliant! I requested for a particular room and was advised it wasn't available until a certain date. I actually re-scheduled my trip and ended up staying an extra day. Hotel rooms are generally smaller in Singapore (I suppose because land is scarce). The New Majestic hotel employ artistic props to make as if the room is bigger than it truly is! During my Singapore trip I also stayed at The Scarlet. Room at The New Majestic is definitely more spacious than The Scarlet. Of course I love the Khiel bathroom products :) Bed was Oh-SOOoooo-Comfortable! So almost couldn't get out of it! LOVE the internet access available in the room & the Ipod Deck Only street parking is available (even if you don't drive/ rent a car, if you have visitors who drive the visitor will have to find street parking) Location: it is in Chinatown of Singapore, very interesting cultural experience but if it is shopping Orchard Rd you are after this hotel isn't a stroll away from Orchard! Taxis & public transportation are very easily available in Singapore though

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel, just a few grumbles”
Reviews.Author: shooxou
Reviews.Content: The New Majestic is a very trendy hotel, with a cool mix of design classics and funky furniture. We had an attic room with 2 deep baths in the middle of the room. Looked great, but there was not enough hot water to fill them both! it took us 3 attempts. When we mentioned it to the GM he seemed like he was told it alot but couldn't do much about it. The room was nice, but had too much furniture in it making it feel smaller than it was. The staff were excellent and the included breakfast was very nice. Located in Chinatown is not the best location in our opinion. It's a nice hotel but in our view there is better in Singapore, namely the Naumi and much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel staff and service”
Reviews.Author: boxxy
Reviews.Content: Its the worst hotel stay i had ever experienced. Even though, i'm a local but the service they gave me was really bad. The staff was rude and we check out of the hotel even before 12am. When we made a complaint to the hotel, the front desk manager even sided with her staff and charged us for a full night stay even though we did not stay through out the night due to the staff bad attitude. The staff behaved like a gangster to customers, and i can't believed that the hotel did not even ask the staff to apologise to us. Personally, as a local, i would not recommed this hotel to anyone if service is your top priority.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but bad experience.”
Reviews.Author: dychan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night at this aqua room. The room was spacious, clean & beautiful design. I also happy that there is a turn-down service in the evening. But we have a sleepless night, as there is a loud music coming from the hotel bar (Majestic bar) till early morning. The water heater is another problem for us, as we might not get a hot/warm water as and when we required. The staff service was horrible, as far as i know the hotel standard check-out time is 12:00PM. But we received a call at 11:40AM to remind us that we need to check-out now where we had requested a late check-out at 12:30PM & agreed by them. The breakfast was very simple & limited choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeFlaneur
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights at the New Majestic. Loved the hotel, especially the open-air (during the day) lobby. Was nice to be in a 'funky' but very comfortable place in an up-and-coming area of town while my colleagues were in big boring corporate hotels. Took me about 7 minutes in a (cheap) taxi to get to Suntec centre each day. Bed was v. comfortable, Kiehl's products a nice touch, shower amazing, food at the restaurant downstairs very good, staff excellent. My only complaints are: -for some reason I have noticed this trend in new Asian hotels: lightswitch weirdness. The lightswitch for the bathroom is neither in, nor anywhere near the bathroom--it is above and to the left of the headboard of the bed. Why?? -Air conditioning: you can adjust the temperature in the room,but as I wanted to open the windows and enjoy the tropical breeze at night I had to specially request that the front desk 'dismantle' the A/C. You can't turn it on/off in your own room. -Restaurant: food was good but the only in-room dining options are set-course menus. Not convenient when it's 10pm and you just want to nibble while writing a business report. I just went downstairs and ordered a la carte in the restaurant. All in all those are just minor gripes. This is a great hotel and I will definitely be staying next time I'm in S'pore.

Reviews.Title: “memorable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: 10179k79
Reviews.Content: The New Majestic proved to be a good choice for our four day fun trip to Singapore. Located in Chinatown right next to the Outram Park subway station (which also offers easy access to the airport), it is in a good spot with lots of atmosphere and food options away from the somewhat "heartless" business district. The hotel's design is unique and fresh, rooms are small but clean and bright and cheery and very well equipped. Some details are not very functional and sub-standard for an upscale hotel, such as hot water boilers that need to be turned on half an hour before taking a shower (and have a pretty small capacity). Switching lights on and off is a science in itself. But those problems seem to be common among designy hotels. The staff tries hard but overall seems somewhat helpless and unprofessional. Obviously not recruited and trained to standard. Breakfast is limited and nothing to write home about, but also not essential in a large city with tropical climate. Despite those drawbacks, the New Majestic offers excellent value for money by Singapore standards and has much more personality than the big chain hotels in the business district. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Love the design”
Reviews.Author: LZW
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights.. Rooms: Really love the design, there is different themes for each rooms. They are clean. Last but not least, I love their loft rooms the most! Location: Within walking distance from Outram Park MRT. Selection for breakfast buffet is extremely limited but it has quality. Customer Service: No complains.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the New Majestic”
Reviews.Author: DaisyNL
Reviews.Content: I stay in big chain hotels on my business trips a lot. I must say that I really enjoyed the New Majestic for being a smaller, boutique style hotel. My room had really cool design, a great bed as well as a docking station for my Ipod, perfect. The gym was on the 2nd floor with glass walls on 4 sides, so that did not make it very inviting to me. I did enjoyed the swimming pool a lot in the morning, with birds welcoming the new day around you! The staff was really friendly and tried to be helpful. I did not experience any problems with hot water after I turned on the hot water button. Breakfast was ok, lunch hower, is fantastic! Wonderful chinese food. I would recommend this hotel if you are fed up with standard business style hotels and would like a hotel a little of the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely design does not excuse bad service.”
Reviews.Author: globalAsian
Reviews.Content: I got a room with 2 bathtubs for S$450++ just to spend the evening soaking in a hot tub next to my husband. It was a marvellous idea, having 2 bathtubs side by side so a couple can enjoy each others company while having a tub filled with water at their own preferred temperature. Unfortunately, there was not enough hot water to fill one tub, much less 2. We spoke to reception on the phone who told us to switch on the heater and wait. After a long dinner, we returned to our room and there was no change in water temperature. Another trip to the front desk resulted in a nonchalant staff telling us that they just don't have enough hot water. We tried to make the most of our stay and asked to see rooms that were not occupied as we've heard so much of the design. Was told to come back in the morning. When we did, we were told there was not enough service staff to bring us around. The room was nice... pillows comfortable. Lighting was well done. Still... not having enough hot water in a 4/5 star hotel is bizarre. It was a wasted stay which left a bad impression.
